content:
• Wednesday, January 4, 2012
  • IRWD

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IRWD) gains 2.5% AH after announcing a collaboration with...

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IRWD) gains 2.5% AH after announcing a collaboration with Australian drug developer Bionomics to develop and commercialize an anti-anxiety compound developed by the latter. It's stated Bionomics "could receive up to $345 million" in payments and research funding from Ironwood, as well as royalties on product sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -6.4%) sold off on high volume after announcing it will offer a mobile broadcast...

    MetroPCS (PCS -6.4%) sold off on high volume after announcing it will offer a mobile broadcast TV service called Dyle; service will initially be offered via a Samsung Android phone. The epic failure of Qualcomm's (NASDAQ:QCOM) FLO TV service (I, II) could have investors on edge, though given rival Leap Wireless (LEAP -7.2%) posted an even larger decline, selling from M&A speculators could also be a factor.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM
  • INHX

    Inhibitex (INHX -6.4%) had an interesting day. Shares fell as much as 16% in early trading,...

    Inhibitex (INHX -6.4%) had an interesting day. Shares fell as much as 16% in early trading, apparently due to cautious comments from BofA's Rachel McMinn, who thinks there could be considerable downside if a safety check for the company's INX-189 hepatitis drug turns up any issues. However, shares pared the majority of their losses after other analysts came to Inhibitex's defense.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) jumps 6.1% AH after stating it expects FQ2 (ended in December) revenue of...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) jumps 6.1% AH after stating it expects FQ2 (ended in December) revenue of $3.1B-$3.2B and FQ3 revenue of $4.2B-$4.5B, well above consensus estimates of $2.8B and $3.6B, respectively. Gross margins are also expected to surge. Seagate was expected to profit handsomely from its minimal exposure to the hard drive industry disruptions caused by Thai flooding; now we know how much. WDC +2.3%

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • HCA

    Shares of hospital firms extended their decline over concerns that government spending may dry...

    Shares of hospital firms extended their decline over concerns that government spending may dry up. A Citigroup note yesterday pinpointed eight firms heavily reliant on Medicare funding that could be especially vulnerable, and each has dropped sharply over two days: HCA -5.6%, HMA -3.4%, LPNT -4.1%, SUNH -3.9%, UHS -4.8%, THC -8.8%, LNCR -4.4%, AHS -8.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) says its Investigational New Drug Application for Proellex-V,...

    Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) says its Investigational New Drug Application for Proellex-V, a vaginally delivered treatment for symptomatic fibroids, has been accepted by the FDA. Shares +1.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • AM-OLD

    American Greetings (NYSE:AM-OLD) authorizes a $75M stock buyback. Shares +2.6% AH.

    American Greetings (NYSE:AM-OLD) authorizes a $75M stock buyback. Shares +2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM (NASDAQ:SIRI) gains 2.2% AH after stating it will end the year with nearly 21.9M...

    Sirius XM (NASDAQ:SIRI) gains 2.2% AH after stating it will end the year with nearly 21.9M subscribers, exceeding its prior guidance. The year-end figure represents a Q/Q increase of 540K subs, and a Y/Y increase of 1.7M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEVA

    Drug developer Synageva BioPharma (NASDAQ:GEVA) drops 2.1% AH after announcing a $60M stock...

    Drug developer Synageva BioPharma (NASDAQ:GEVA) drops 2.1% AH after announcing a $60M stock offering - equal to 13.6% of its market cap as of today's close. The company only says it plans to use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes." (prospectus)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +11.4%), which soared today after releasing encouraging streaming data, drops 1.5%...

    Netflix (NFLX +11.4%), which soared today after releasing encouraging streaming data, drops 1.5% AH after Verizon (NYSE:VZ) states at a Citi conference it has no interest in acquiring a streaming services provider. A rumor had previously surfaced that Verizon was eying Netflix. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Sports apparel vendor Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) rises 11.7% AH after reporting same-store sales grew...

    Sports apparel vendor Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) rises 11.7% AH after reporting same-store sales grew 10% Y/Y, and total sales grew 18.1% Y/Y, in December. As a result of the strong holiday performance, Zumiez now expects revenue of $180M-$181M and EPS of $0.57-$0.58 in FQ4 (ends in January), above a consensus of $176.8M and $0.54.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ASR

    Mexican airline Grupo Aeroportuario del Sureste (ASR +2.9%) gains today after saying total...

    Mexican airline Grupo Aeroportuario del Sureste (ASR +2.9%) gains today after saying total passenger traffic for December 2011 increased by 15.3% Y/Y. Domestic traffic saw a 22.3% increase while international traffic grew 10.4% compared to the same month last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • VZ

    Verizon (VZ -1.4%) takes a bit of a dive as word from a Citigroup conference has the company...

    Verizon (VZ -1.4%) takes a bit of a dive as word from a Citigroup conference has the company saying it sold 4.2M iPhones (NASDAQ:AAPL) in Q4, but saw profit margins decline 5-6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • RL

    Retail stocks rally as investors gear up for tomorrow’s holiday sales reporting, with...

    Retail stocks rally as investors gear up for tomorrow’s holiday sales reporting, with apparel chains and luxury names among the day's top performers. Ralph Lauren (RL +4.2%) leads the S&P 500; among other strong gainers are VFC +3.4%, GAP +2.6%, URBN +2.9%. "Indications are that volumes were up in December, so same-store sales figures will likely look good," Atlantic Equities says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • TEVA

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA +1%) says it's restarting generic animal-vaccine production at its...

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA +1%) says it's restarting generic animal-vaccine production at its Missouri plant, after spending $14M on bringing it up to compliance. Work was shut down there in 2009, after the plant failed to comply with manufacturing regulations involving quality control, employee training and manufacturing practices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • ES

    The proposed $4.3B merger between Northeast Utilities (NU -1.7%) and Nstar (NST -3.7%) will be...

    The proposed $4.3B merger between Northeast Utilities (NU -1.7%) and Nstar (NST -3.7%) will be reviewed by utility regulators in Connecticut, reversing the state's decision last year not to review the transaction, the Hartford Courant reports. The preliminary decision throws a new barrier in the way of the deal that would create a $17.5B utility, just three months before the deal expires.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -3.3%) move off their daily lows after a report emerges saying...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -3.3%) move off their daily lows after a report emerges saying that the firm has put Sterling Publishing up for sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • CSFL

    Shares of CenterState Banks (CSFL +3.4%) continue to move higher - having racked up a 40% rally...

    Shares of CenterState Banks (CSFL +3.4%) continue to move higher - having racked up a 40% rally since early December alone - getting another boost today from a Wunderlich upgrade to Buy. The firm says the banks is aggressively resolving problem assets and positioning the stock to move materially higher as the economy improves over the next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN +1.7%) says it's appointed Marc Stapley as CFO. Stapley, a former Pfizer VP, be...

    Illumina (ILMN +1.7%) says it's appointed Marc Stapley as CFO. Stapley, a former Pfizer VP, be responsible for overseeing finance, accounting, facilities and investor relations functions.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • INFA

    Informatica (INFA -5.8%) makes new 52-week lows after Stifel says its checks suggest the data...

    Informatica (INFA -5.8%) makes new 52-week lows after Stifel says its checks suggest the data warehousing software firm is facing the same challenges in closing major deals that Oracle said it encountered in its FQ2. Nonetheless, Stifel is maintaining a Buy on Informatica, and its $54 PT represents a 53% increase from current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • NFX

    Raymond James cuts a number of independent oil & gas stocks today, citing increased...

    Raymond James cuts a number of independent oil & gas stocks today, citing increased competition: Newfield Exploration (NFX -1%) and Quicksilver Resources (KWK -1.1%) are both cut to Market Perform, and Cimarex Energy (XEC -3.2%) is reduced to Outperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK -22.9%) plans to file for a Chapter 11 bankruptcy if efforts in the next few...

    Eastman Kodak (EK -22.9%) plans to file for a Chapter 11 bankruptcy if efforts in the next few weeks to sell a horde of digital patents fall flat, reports the WSJ. Sources say a February filing could involve a $1B debtor-in-possession financing arrangement to keep the firm afloat.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYT

    U.S. chemical companies using natural gas as a feedstock have an advantage over European rivals...

    U.S. chemical companies using natural gas as a feedstock have an advantage over European rivals that rely on more expensive crude, Citi says as it upgrades chemical maker Cytec (CYT +3.7%) to Buy. Citi also likes Cytec's ability to make carbon fiber, which is becoming a bigger component of new aircraft models like the Boeing 787.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • VMED

    Virgin Media (VMED -2%) trades lower after RBS cut the shares to Hold from Buy, citing a...

    Virgin Media (VMED -2%) trades lower after RBS cut the shares to Hold from Buy, citing a difficult macro environment and increased competition.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • MA

    Janney downgrades MasterCard (MA -3.7%) and Visa (V -2.2%) to Neutral, predicting consumers will...

    Janney downgrades MasterCard (MA -3.7%) and Visa (V -2.2%) to Neutral, predicting consumers will continue to reduce their debt this year and create a "sluggish" environment for growth in credit card companies. The analysts' "best idea" for 2012 in the space is Mitek Systems (MITK -2%), which makes software that allows users to "deposit" checks with their cellphones.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • FSLR

    Shares of First Solar (FSLR -3.3%) dip after Bank of America says alternative energy shares are...

    Shares of First Solar (FSLR -3.3%) dip after Bank of America says alternative energy shares are going to have "more pain before the gain" this year and "sustained outperformance" won't come until at least 2013. Also, speculation is circulating that the company may appoint a new CEO as early as tonight.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • ERIC

    Contributing to weakness in Ericsson (ERIC -4.1%) (previously) is a downgrade to Sector Perform...

    Contributing to weakness in Ericsson (ERIC -4.1%) (previously) is a downgrade to Sector Perform from Pac Crest's James Faucette, who notes carriers have largely been able to avoid increasing capex in spite of soaring data traffic growth, and claims future capex will be pressured by slow carrier revenue growth. Like a recent UBS note about Juniper, Faucette's comments have implications for other telecom equipment names.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • MDP

    Meredith Corp. (MDP -2%) deepens its foray into the women-focused media space by acquiring...

    Meredith Corp. (MDP -2%) deepens its foray into the women-focused media space by acquiring FamilyFun magazine and related assets from Walt Disney Co.'s (NYSE:DIS) publishing arm for an undisclosed sum. The magazine, which has an audience of about 6M, targets mothers with children ages 3 to 12 and focuses on family activities, such as cooking, crafts and travel.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • DWDP

    DuPont (DD +0.7%) says it will team up with NexSteppe to develop biofuel feedstocks and other...

    DuPont (DD +0.7%) says it will team up with NexSteppe to develop biofuel feedstocks and other bio-related products. The collaboration will focus on the use of new sweet sorghum and high biomass hybrids that can provide a "drop-in" cheaper solution for sugar mills, according to CEO Anna Rath.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • CMC

    Commercial Metals' (CMC +2.8%) board urges stockholders reject billionaire Carl Icahn's board...

    Commercial Metals' (CMC +2.8%) board urges stockholders reject billionaire Carl Icahn's board nominees, and once again calls to reject Icahn's unsolicited tender offer as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • NATI

    Shares of National Instruments (NATI -6.3%) fall back after the firm issues preliminary earnings...

    Shares of National Instruments (NATI -6.3%) fall back after the firm issues preliminary earnings estimates for Q4. The instrument manufacturer now sees EPS falling in a range of $0.26 to $0.27, lower than its prior guidance of $0.29-$0.37.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM

  • Microcap BioMimetric Therapeutics (BTMI -15.4%) extends steep losses realized AH yesterday...

    Microcap BioMimetric Therapeutics (BTMI -15.4%) extends steep losses realized AH yesterday following the rejection by the FDA of the firm's bone-graft device. Shares now trade at their lowest level since 2006.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • AN

    A group of hedge funds led by Edward Lampert cut their stake in AutoNation (AN -3.8%) by 42% due...

    A group of hedge funds led by Edward Lampert cut their stake in AutoNation (AN -3.8%) by 42% due to fund redemptions and reorganizations, according to a SEC filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • EBAY

    There's more going on with today's slide in eBay (EBAY -4%) shares than mere disappointment at...

    There's more going on with today's slide in eBay (EBAY -4%) shares than mere disappointment at the loss of a key executive. Robert W. Baird's Colin Sebastian thinks it means any potential PayPal spinoff isn't likely to happen. Scott Thompson wanted to run his own shop, and it wasn’t going to happen any time soon at eBay. YHOO -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • PVH

    Warnaco (WRC +5.1%) moves higher after Morgan Stanley ups the shares to Equalweight, citing...

    Warnaco (WRC +5.1%) moves higher after Morgan Stanley ups the shares to Equalweight, citing fewer Q/Q promotions compared to its peers over the holidays, which it expects will boost Q4 gross margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • PNFP

    Pinnacle Financial Partners (PNFP -3.6%) dips after Wunderlich follows Stern Agee's lead...

    Pinnacle Financial Partners (PNFP -3.6%) dips after Wunderlich follows Stern Agee's lead (yesterday) by downgrading the shares to Hold today on valuation. The stock has been on fire as of late, having gained over 50% since early October.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • EDMC

    A number of education-related stocks trade lower after a couple of analyst downgrades (I, II)...

    A number of education-related stocks trade lower after a couple of analyst downgrades (I, II) paint a gloomy picture of the sector. Decliners: EDMC -5.1%, CECO -3.2%, OTC:NAUH -2.5%, BPI -2.6%, LINC -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • STRA

    Piper Jaffray clips its price target on Strayer Education (STRA -1.1%) by $7 to $98 after...

    Piper Jaffray clips its price target on Strayer Education (STRA -1.1%) by $7 to $98 after reassessing its FY12 EPS estimate for the firm. Analysts take down their assigned multiple for price-earnings to 12X from 13X on sector weakness in lining up their revised PT.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • SBUX

    An order of coffee or food at Starbucks (SBUX +2.4%) can easily hit $5 for a customer, so its...

    An order of coffee or food at Starbucks (SBUX +2.4%) can easily hit $5 for a customer, so its move to raise prices in some parts of the U.S. may seem risky. But with the weight of recent success behind it, Doug McIntyre says Starbucks has joined the ranks of rare companies who raise prices simply because they can.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • AABA

    Yahoo's (YHOO -1.8%) hiring of PayPal (EBAY -3.6%) CEO Scott Thompson has investors seeing...

    Yahoo's (YHOO -1.8%) hiring of PayPal (EBAY -3.6%) CEO Scott Thompson has investors seeing the probable end of evaluation of strategic alternatives, but Wall Street analysts offer lukewarm praise. Piper Jaffray's Gene Munster believes the hire is a "slight positive" since it is "likely to refocus employees who had lacked a permanent CEO for months."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • APKT

    Nomura says to be cautious about reading too much into Acme Packet's (APKT -19.3%) revenue miss...

    Nomura says to be cautious about reading too much into Acme Packet's (APKT -19.3%) revenue miss due to its small size and focus niche end markets. The firm notes that much of the weakness indicated by its Q4 warning is already baked into telecom provider estimates. Their top picks in the space: Ericsson (ERIC -4.2%) and Cisco (CSCO +0.2%)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP -2.5%) witnesses selling pressure following a downgrade to Neutral from Credit...

    NetApp (NTAP -2.5%) witnesses selling pressure following a downgrade to Neutral from Credit Suisse, whose survey of 47 storage administrators suggests unfavorable "competitive dynamics" in the mid-range storage market. Archrival EMC has been posting strong mid-range growth following the release of its VNX storage line, and Gartner claims NetApp lost some market share in Q3. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • LOOP-OLD

    Loopnet (LOOP-OLD -6.2%) shares sink on fears that the FTC may block the company's pending...

    Loopnet (LOOP-OLD -6.2%) shares sink on fears that the FTC may block the company's pending acquisition by CoStar (CSGP -1.8%) after it files to extend the antitrust review waiting period for a second time. LOOP and CSGP have similar business, as both are providers of commercial real estate information.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • CME

    CME Group (CME -1.9%) dips this morning, in spite of its announcement that overall volume jumped...

    CME Group (CME -1.9%) dips this morning, in spite of its announcement that overall volume jumped 10% in 2011 to a record 13.4M contracts per day. The surge was led by record average daily volume for foreign exchange, agricultural commodities, energy and metals products. Q4 volume declined however, to an average 11.7M contracts per day, due primarily to a sizeable decrease in interest-rate futures activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • LUK-OLD

    Executives and employees at Jefferies' (JEF -2.8%) prime brokerage unit have threatened to leave...

    Executives and employees at Jefferies' (JEF -2.8%) prime brokerage unit have threatened to leave over issues including the recent restructuring and year-end compensation, WSJ reports. Glen Dailey yesterday was named co-head of the unit, and prime brokerage execs reportedly won a better compensation structure, with added certainty of potential gains for employees.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • IMI

    Intermolecular (NASDAQ:IMI), a provider of R&D services for the semiconductor and...

    Intermolecular (NASDAQ:IMI), a provider of R&D services for the semiconductor and alternative energy industries, is up 3.2% after JPMorgan starts coverage with an Overweight and $17 PT. JPMorgan expects Intermolecular's unique business model, in which the company collects both fixed payments and product royalties in exchange for its services, to drive 40% compound annual revenue growth growth over the next 3 years. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • CRM

    Sanford Bernstein's Mark Moerdler says growth at Salesforce.com (CRM -4.3%) is slowing, and the...

    Sanford Bernstein's Mark Moerdler says growth at Salesforce.com (CRM -4.3%) is slowing, and the hosted software vendor is relying on acquisitions to mask the situation. Moerdler concludes that growth in CRM’s traditional “customer relationship management" business slowed to 22% in 1H 2011 vs. 40% in the prior-year period.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • TRIDQ

    Entropic (ENTR -4.4%) slightly raises its Q4 guidance for EPS to $0.11 and for revenue to $56M,...

    Entropic (ENTR -4.4%) slightly raises its Q4 guidance for EPS to $0.11 and for revenue to $56M, above Street forecasts in both cases. The company, which designs chipsets for video and broadband multimedia applications, also says it will bid $55M for assets of Trident Microsystems' (TRID) set-top box chips business.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM

  • Reuters reports Tehran as saying it has alternative outlets for its crude if the EU bans...

    Reuters reports Tehran as saying it has alternative outlets for its crude if the EU bans imports. Scott Barber helpfully provides some figures showing the EU accounts for 18% of Iran's crude exports. WTI crude is red again, off 0.4% to $102.56 while Brent crude (the world benchmark) is +0.5% to $112.56.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • AABA

    So much for going private; Yahoo (YHOO -2.3%) chairman Roy Bostock on buyout possibilities: "We...

    So much for going private; Yahoo (YHOO -2.3%) chairman Roy Bostock on buyout possibilities: "We are a public company. I do not envision us not being a public company going forward."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • AN

    AutoNation (AN -4.4%) dips lower after automobile companies start reporting December sales...

    AutoNation (AN -4.4%) dips lower after automobile companies start reporting December sales figures. The firm was seen as possibly benefiting from a jump in consumer spending in the sector over the last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • CEI

    Lucas Energy (LEI +3.7%), a small but growing player in in the massive Eagle Ford Shale field,...

    Lucas Energy (LEI +3.7%), a small but growing player in in the massive Eagle Ford Shale field, says it's acquired all of Hall Phoenix Energy's interest in its oil, gas, and mineral leases in the Eagle Ford Trend for $6.4M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • GDP

    Investors take a shine to Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +9.3%) after the firm releases detailed budget...

    Investors take a shine to Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +9.3%) after the firm releases detailed budget and earnings guidance. The upshot of the firm's report is that it will double oil production this year, while reducing spending by as much as 24%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • VHS

    Shares of Vanguard Health Systems (VHS -9.1%) take a tumble after Citi analyst Gary Taylor slaps...

    Shares of Vanguard Health Systems (VHS -9.1%) take a tumble after Citi analyst Gary Taylor slaps a downgrade on the healthcare network operator to a Neutral rating from Buy. He notes that the firm's large exposure to large urban markets leaves it more susceptible to Medicare cuts than peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • ALNY

    Alynylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +3.3%) trades higher after the firm releases positive results...

    Alynylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +3.3%) trades higher after the firm releases positive results from clinical tests of its cholesterol-reducing treatment. The firm says it will continue the study with increased dosages.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet's (APKT -18.4%) Q4 bombshell is leading to broad-based weakness in networking...

    Acme Packet's (APKT -18.4%) Q4 bombshell is leading to broad-based weakness in networking equipment names, as the company's soft guidance and comments about soft demand from North American telcos lead to fears of a weak 2012 capex environment. JNPR -4%. FFIV -3.5%. RVBD -2.6%. ALU -5.9%. ERIC -3.6%.  CSCO -1.1%. ARUN -3.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • REE

    Rare Element Resources (NYSEMKT:REE) +3.2% after reporting a 38% increase of measured and...

    Rare Element Resources (NYSEMKT:REE) +3.2% after reporting a 38% increase of measured and indicated rare-earth mineral resources at its Bear Lodge, Wyoming, project. Total REO contained in all the high-grade deposits in all resource categories increased 26% to 830M kg. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) investors may not be happy PayPal's Scott Thompson has been named CEO . but eBay...

    Yahoo (YHOO) investors may not be happy PayPal's Scott Thompson has been named CEO ... but eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) investors are even more upset Thompson will no longer be in charge of their company's biggest growth engine. Shares -3.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: S&P futures -0.4% and EU bourses are mostly in the red on eurozone concerns,...

    Market preview: S&P futures -0.4% and EU bourses are mostly in the red on eurozone concerns, including bank liquidity after UniCredit said it will sell new shares in a $9.8B offer to strengthen its capital position. TiVo surges 12.8% on a patent settlement, but Acme Packet -18.2% following its profit warning. Later: factory orders, U.S. auto sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • LCAV

    LCA-Vision (NASDAQ:LCAV) performed 30% more laser-vision correction services during Q4 than a...

    LCA-Vision (NASDAQ:LCAV) performed 30% more laser-vision correction services during Q4 than a year ago, marking only its second Y/Y quarterly increase in the eye procedures since Q3 2007. Consumers have been cutting back on elective medical procedures due to the weak economy and increasing out-of-pocket healthcare expenses. LCAV +8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • LMT

    Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) is downgraded to Underperform at RBC, ahead of a possible cut to its...

    Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) is downgraded to Underperform at RBC, ahead of a possible cut to its troubled F-35 Joint Strike Fighter program. RBC sees 2012 as a challenging year for the defense sector, with a reduced Defense Department budget plus "persistent uncertainty as to what exactly the cuts will be, and when they will occur." LMT -1.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • LULU

    Goldman Sachs adds Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) to its Conviction Buy list with a $64 six-month price...

    Goldman Sachs adds Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) to its Conviction Buy list with a $64 six-month price target in play. Analyst Michelle Tan calls out LULU's brand (not stock) momentum, and sees the controversy over the retailer's high inventory as providing a good entry point with significant upside potential for APS existing. Shares +3.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM
  • ACHN

    The FDA grants fast-track status to Achillion's (NASDAQ:ACHN) hepatitis C drug, which is in a...

    The FDA grants fast-track status to Achillion's (NASDAQ:ACHN) hepatitis C drug, which is in a mid-stage trial. (PR) Shares +3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
